page.title: 10Life Of Mr. Richards (cont.)
page.content: has six children, four boys and two girls, and ten grandchildren. It was hard to bring up the children in those days because there was no family allowance and no money from the government. Mr. Richards had fifty acres of Council farmland and it was an arable and livestock farm. He has been living in the farmhouse for 49 years and when he retired in 1977 the Council took his land from him. He didn't want to retire because he enjoyed his work so much, but he was ill. Nowadays Mr. Richards goes to town once or twice a week and he enjoys gardening. He also visits his sons and daughters. He says he's had a nice life and would relive it if he had the chance.
